3. Antidepressants (03:26)

Suede's 10th studio album 'Antidepressants', released 5th September 2025, is a milestone achievement that sees the band at the top of their game. It follows the success of their critically-acclaimed ninth top 10 album 'Autofiction' released in September 2022, which charted at No.2 on the UK Albums Chart and was their highest-charting release in over 20 years. Suede celebrate the release of 'Antidepressants' with a takeover of London's Southbank Centre, through a series of exciting live performances with a four-night residency.

item.title: 【Albums (lossless)】FLAC - Paul Mauriat - Blooming Hits (1998) FLAC
item.description:
​

Artist: Paul Mauriat
Title: Blooming Hits
Year Of Release: 1998
Label: Mercury Music Group
Genre: Instrumental Pop, Easy Listening, Orchestral Pop
Quality: FLAC
Total Time: 00:25:39
Total Size: 152 MB

Blooming Hits" is a studio instrumental album by Paul Mauriat and His Orchestra. It achieved significant success in the United States, reaching the number one spot on the Billboard 200 chart. The album was requested by Philips Records after the single "Love Is Blue" became a number one hit on the Billboard Hot 100. The album includes instrumental covers of popular songs such as "Penny Lane" by The Beatles, "There's a Kind of Hush" by Herman's Hermits, "Somethin' Stupid" by Frank and Nancy Sinatra, and "Puppet on a String" by Sandie Shaw, the 1967 Eurovision Song Contest winner.

Tracklist:
01-01 Paul Mauriat - Ces mots stupides [2:40]

item.title: 【Albums (lossless)】FLAC - Jean-Michel Jarre - Live In Bratislava (2025) FLAC (tracks)
item.description:
​


Artist: Jean-Michel Jarre
Title: Live In Bratislava
Year Of Release: 2025
Label: Sony Music Catalog
Genre: Electronic
Quality:FLAC (tracks)
Total Time: 01:40:55
Total Size: 634 MB


https://music.apple.com/us/album/live-in-bratislava/1830716571

Tracklist:

CD1
1. The Opening Bratislava (4:36)
2. Epica Oxygene (3:20)
3. Oxygene 2 (7:32)
4. Web Spinner (3:25)
5. Equinoxe 4 (5:25)
6. Equinoxe 7 (4:05)
7. Falling Down (3:30)
8. Industrial Revolution P2 (3:01)
9. The Architect (3:35)
10. Zero Gravity (5:03)
11. Rendez-vous Bratislava (feat. Brian May) (8:42)
12. Cosmic Guitar Solo Part 1 (2:32)

CD2
1. New World Symphony Bratislava (feat. Brian May) (3:15)
2. Cosmic Guitar Solo Part 2 (3:17)
3. Azimuth (4:59)
4. Exit (6:10)
5. Herbalizer (4:28)
6. Oxygene 19 (4:02)
7. Glory (4:44)
8. Rendez-Vous 4 (4:15)
9. Stardust (4:33)
10. Bratislava Time (feat. Brian May) (6:37)

On 12 May 2024, Jean-Michel Jarre and special guest Sir Brian May electrified the Bratislava skies with 'Bridge from the Future', the opening concert of the seventh edition of the STARMUS Festival. The live performance of 22 tracks took place against the breathtaking backdrop of the SNP Bridge (UFO Bridge). During the afternoon, as the audience were congregating around the Danube from throughout the city, they were welcomed by a brand new composition titled 'Bridge from the future - Live in Bratislava'. The music was specially created by Jarre specifically for this event, where real sounds of the stars were weaved into the soundscape, inviting the audience to consider our position on Earth within the cosmos, and the future of our home planet, reflecting the theme of the year's edition of the STARMUS Festival.
